content: Two-time WNBA MVP Breanna Stewart will make her return Monday for the Liberty after missing 13 games with a bone bruise in her right knee.

title: Wolverines go with freshman Underwood as QB1
content: True freshman Bryce Underwood has been named Michigan's starting quarterback for the Wolverines' opener vs. New Mexico, coach Sherrone Moore said.

content: The Saints released veteran running back Cam Akers as they began to trim their roster to 53 players Monday.

content: Here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers returning from injury.

title: Himachal Up, Bihar, Northeast Down: How Rain Went Off-Track This Monsoon
content: The monsoon this year has witnessed several short and intense spells of rainfall in many states because of climate variability, Senior Scientist in India Meteorological Department or IMD, Dr. Naresh Kumar told NDTV on Monday.

title: Rights Group, Manipur Ex Chief Minister Allege Report On Ethnic Violence "Biased", Seek Legal Action
content: Manipur's former chief minister N Biren Singh, in his first public reaction to a report by a Delhi-based non-profit on the ethnic violence in the northeast state bordering Myanmar, alleged the report "serves only to deepen divides".

title: No Withdrawal, Stage Set For Direct NDA, Opposition Contest For Veep's Post
content: With neither of the two candidates for the vice presidential election withdrawing their nomination, the stage is set for a direct contest between ruling NDA nominee C P Radhakrishnan and joint opposition candidate B Sudershan Reddy on September 9.

title: Japan Police "Apologise" For Death Of Innocent Man After Long Detention
content: Japan's top law enforcement officials apologised to the family of a businessman who was wrongfully arrested and died after a months-long detention.

title: "Don't Play With...": BJP Mysuru MP On Banu Mushtaq Inaugurating Dasara Festival
content: Booker Prize-winning author Banu Mushtaq is being cancelled by the BJP. The reason: a Muslim inaugurating the world-famous Mysuru Dasara festivities, which traditionally begin with rituals at the Chamundi Hill temple.

title: 2 Arrested For Kidnapping, Sale Of Adopted Child Of Transwoman In Gurugram
content: A transwoman was arrested on Monday for allegedly selling a seven-day-old boy, adopted recently by another transwoman, to a man for Rs 1.5 lakh, police said.

title: Trump Moves To Ban Flag Burning Despite Supreme Court Ruling To Allow It
content: President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order requiring the Justice Department to investigate and prosecute people for burning the American flag.

title: Man Kills 75-Year-Old Tribal Woman For 'Practising' Witchcraft In Jharkhand
content: An elderly tribal woman was killed by a neighbour for allegedly practising witchcraft in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district, a police officer said on Monday.

title: UP Announces Scholarship In Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's Name For Space Tech Students
content: UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday announced a new scholarship in the name of astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian man to travel to the ISS, which will support students from the state pursuing higher education in space technology

title: Netanyahu Says Israel "Regrets Tragic Mishap" After Reporters Killed In Gaza
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expressed his regret Monday for a strike that killed 20 people, including five journalists, at a hospital in the Gaza Strip.

title: Delhi High Court Sets Aside Panel's Order To Disclose Smriti Irani's Degree
content: The Delhi High Court on Monday set aside an order of the Central Information Commission (CIC) directing CBSE to provide copies of the Class X and XII records of BJP leader Smriti Irani.

title: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sumitra Balmik Stopped at Party Meeting, Argues with Police
content: A controversy erupted on Saturday when Rajya Sabha MP Sumitra Balmik was stopped outside the BJP office in Jabalpur, where party national president JP Nadda was attending a key meeting with senior leaders.

title: "Our Soldiers Didn't Kill Terrorists Based On Religion But Because Of Their Deeds": Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday asserted that Indian forces gave a "befitting reply" to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor and "our soldiers did not kill terrorists based on their religion, but because of their deeds".

title: Days After Top Court Order, Stray Dog Attacks Child Inside Police Colony In Delhi
content: A five-year-old boy sustained multiple deep bites after being attacked by a stray dog inside a police colony in east Delhi's Shakarpur, officials said on Monday.

title: 26 Lakh Ineligible Beneficiaries Of Ladki Bahin Scheme In Maharashtra: Minister
content: The Maharashtra government has prima facie identified 26 lakh ineligible beneficiaries of the Ladki Bahin scheme for women, state minister Aditi Tatkare said on Monday.

title: Row Over Bhopal MP Alok Sharma's Remarks, Congress Calls Him "Anti-National"
content: A fresh political controversy erupted after BJP MP Alok Sharma, declared that "this Bhopal is not the Bhopal of Muslims...this Bhopal belongs to Emperor Ashoka, the Pratihars, Chandragupta Maurya, Raja Bhoj Parmar, and Queen Kamlapati."

title: AAP's 'Fake Case Conspiracy' Charge Amid Row Over Bill To Sack Ministers
content: Aam Aadmi Party national media in-charge Anurag Dhanda slammed Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the newly proposed 130th Constitution Amendment Bill, alleging that the BJP had conspired to bring down the AAP government in Delhi

title: Gurugram Realty Firm "Diverted" Rs 205-Crore Homebuyers' Fund For Sri Lanka Hotel: Probe Agency
content: A Gurugram-based realty group collected more than Rs 500 crore from home buyers in the name of giving them housing plots but cheated them and "diverted" about Rs 205 crore out of these funds for a hotel project in Sri Lanka

title: Documents Of Over 99% Electors Received For Bihar Voter List
content: The Election Commission on Monday said that documents of 99.11 per cent of the 7.24 crore electors in Bihar, as per the draft list, have been received so far.

title: "Constitution My Ideology": Opposition's Veep Pick On Salwa Judum Verdict
content: B Sudershan Reddy, who retired from the top court in 2011, was part of a Bench that had declared Salwa Judum, appointed by the Chhattisgarh government, as unconstitutional.

title: Trump's tariff war: How India, China & Russia are testing US power - what's next
content: President Trump's trade policies, including tariffs on Indian goods, are pushing India towards closer ties with China and Russia. This potential alignment, facilitated by Russia, aims to challenge US dominance. While India remains cautious due to existing tensions and economic reliance on the US, the tariffs have created an opportunity for diplomatic reset.

title: 'Never in India's history': Amit Shah reveals what led to his 2-year Gujarat exile
content: Amit Shah clarified his departure from Gujarat during the Sohrabuddin Sheikh case. He stated he offered to leave after a court expressed concerns about evidence tampering. Shah also defended the government's bill regarding the removal of lawmakers facing serious charges. He highlighted his own resignation upon receiving a CBI summons. The bill is currently under review by a parliamentary committee.

title: 'Stop making reels': Vipin was unhappy with Nikki's habit; opposed reopening of parlour
content: Nikki Bhati's tragic death, allegedly by her husband and in-laws, stemmed from conflicts over her social media use and financial aspirations. Vipin opposed Nikki's Instagram reels and plans to reopen her beauty parlor, leading to heated arguments and violence.

title: 'Will withstand all pressure': PM Modi's defiant note as US tariff looms
content: Prime Minister Modi pledged unwavering support for India's small entrepreneurs, farmers, and animal keepers amidst rising economic pressures. His statement comes as US President Trump's 50% tariff on Indian goods is set to take effect. India has criticized the US tariffs as unjustified, vowing to protect its domestic stakeholders and pursue an independent trade policy.

title: 'Give him boxing gloves': Sachin Tendulkar's dig at umpire Steve Bucknor
content: Sachin Tendulkar recently reminisced about his epic battles with Australian legends Glenn McGrath and Shane Warne, recalling a strategic assault on McGrath in a 2000 match. He also humorously addressed controversial umpiring decisions by Steve Bucknor. Tendulkar dominated Warne, scoring 123 runs without being dismissed.

title: Google abandons virtual hiring model: CEO says AI cheating unstoppable;
content: Google is reintroducing in-person job interviews as CEO Sundar Pichai addresses concerns about AI-driven cheating during virtual hiring. This decision marks a shift from the remote practices adopted during the pandemic. Employees raised the issue, prompting Google to balance efficiency with the need to ensure the authenticity of the hiring process, acknowledging that competitors face similar challenges.

title: 'Thoroughly misconceived': Delhi HC sets aside CIC order on Smriti Irani's degree
content: The Delhi High Court overturned orders from the Central Information Commission (CIC) mandating CBSE to disclose Smriti Irani's 10th and 12th grade results, citing a misconstrued approach. The court also quashed a CIC directive to reveal details of PM Modi's bachelor's degree, emphasizing that personal academic information isn't inherently public, aligning with a Supreme Court judgment.

title: More Intel-like deals coming soon? What Trump's aide said
content: The U.S. government's $8.9 billion stake in Intel, facilitated by the CHIPS Act, signals a novel investment approach, according to Kevin Hassett. While the government aims for financial returns without interfering in company operations, Intel cautions about potential risks, including reduced grant opportunities and adverse impacts on its global business.

title: 'At some point': Trump signals readiness for meeting Kim Jong Un; hints at renewed talks
content: Donald Trump expressed openness to meeting North Korean leader Kim Jong Un "at some point," ahead of South Korean President Lee Jae Myung's visit to the White House. Trump highlighted their past turbulent relationship, marked by initial threats and subsequent historic meetings, including a summit in Singapore and a DMZ encounter. Despite collapsed talks in Hanoi, Trump suggested a future meeting remains a possibility.

title: Salary question: Bill Gates on ‚Äòcompulsory‚Äô interview ask; What Microsoft founder answered
content: Bill Gates shared his perspective on handling the salary expectation question during job interviews, advocating for a focus on long-term vision and stock options over immediate cash. In a 2020 mock interview, he emphasized the importance of transparency and trust, signaling confidence in the company's potential.

title: Masterstroke! When Sachin Tendulkar predicted England's 'future captain' and was right
content: Sachin Tendulkar fondly recalls Joe Root's Test debut in Nagpur in 2012, where he immediately recognized Root's potential. Tendulkar was impressed by Root's composure, technique, and ability to assess the wicket, leading him to predict Root's future captaincy.

title: Happy Onam 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages, and quotes to share
content: Onam, a major festival of Kerala, is set to be celebrated. The festival honors King Mahabali and the harvest season. People exchange wishes and greetings. Festivities include feasts, boat races, and floral decorations. Onam symbolizes unity and new beginnings. Many heartfelt messages and quotes are shared among loved ones. The festival brings joy and strengthens bonds.

title: Mysuru Dasara inauguration row: BJP says Banu Mushtaq's 'faith uncertain'; minister hits back
content: Karnataka's decision to have Banu Mushtaq inaugurate Mysuru Dasara has sparked controversy, with BJP leaders questioning the appropriateness of someone with uncertain faith leading a Hindu religious ceremony. While some respect Mushtaq's achievements, they believe she should preside over literary events instead. The Congress government defends the decision, stating Dasara is a national festival, not solely a religious one.

title: AI and jobs: Microsoft AI CEO to workers; My central worry is many will be left behind
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman cautions that AI's rapid advancement may outpace people's ability to adapt, leading to a significant skill gap rather than widespread job losses. He urges governments, companies, and educators to prioritize reskilling programs and digital literacy.

title: Tommy Fleetwood celebrates first European Tour win by honouring his dog Maisy
content: English golfer Tommy Fleetwood celebrated his 2013 Johnnie Walker Championship victory with his beloved dog, Maisy, who was battling cancer. This heartwarming gesture highlighted Fleetwood's deep affection for animals, a trait evident since childhood. Years later, his fondness continues as he happily interacts with dogs at tournaments, showcasing his kindness and solidifying his connection with fans beyond the golf course.

title: Big statement! Sachin Tendulkar on life after Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma
content: Sachin Tendulkar recently engaged with fans on Reddit, reminiscing about his prediction of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma carrying his legacy. He acknowledged their contributions to Indian cricket and highlighted the promising future with emerging talents. Kohli and Rohit, now focused on ODIs, are set to play a crucial series against Australia in October, bridging experience with the next generation.

title: Inside Tommy Fleetwood‚Äôs net worth and love story with wife who once rejected him
content: Tommy Fleetwood, a top-earning golfer with over $31 million from the PGA Tour and $35 million from the DP World Tour, owes much of his success to his wife, Clare. Despite a 23-year age difference and initial hesitations about mixing business with romance, Clare became Fleetwood's manager and life partner.

title: Syko Stu‚Äôs brother speaks after Raja Jackson attack, issues scam alert
content: Independent wrestler Syko Stu was brutally attacked by Raja Jackson at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event, resulting in severe injuries and an LAPD investigation. Stu's brother, Andrew, has released a statement confirming Stu is in critical care and warning fans about fraudulent GoFundMe campaigns.

title: Cowboys‚Äô Jerry Jones moves to block Micah Parsons trade
content: Despite a contract dispute and trade request from Micah Parsons, former NFL GM Doug Whaley believes the star pass rusher will remain with the Dallas Cowboys. Whaley points to past situations with Myles Garrett and T.J. Watt, where money ultimately resolved similar issues.

title: Is Cong against peace? Sukma, Bastar villagers' oppose INDIA bloc's VP pick
content: Villagers from Sukma and Bastar, Chhattisgarh, who are victims of Naxal violence, have appealed to Members of Parliament not to support B Sudershan Reddy for Vice-President. They criticize his past order against the Salwa Judum movement, claiming it emboldened insurgents. BJP leaders also question Reddy's alleged leniency towards Maoism, raising concerns about his suitability for the high constitutional office.

title: Jaswinder Bhalla‚Äôs Bhog and Antim Ardaas on August 30, son Pukhraj shares details
content: Popular Punjabi actor and comedian Jaswinder Bhalla passed away on August 22, 2025, at the age of 65, following an illness. Known for his roles in films like 'Carry On Jatta' and 'Gaddi Chaldi Hai Chhalla Maarke,' Bhalla's death has prompted tributes from across the entertainment industry, including Bollywood stars.

title: 'I have to go back again ... ': Rohit Sharma opens up, leaves fans emotional
content: Rohit Sharma, reflecting on his Test career, emphasized the format's mental and physical demands, highlighting the importance of preparation for sustaining performance. He acknowledged that while initial focus was on enjoyment, guidance from senior players and coaches instilled the value of thorough preparation.

title: Jilted lover brutally kills married woman at Mysuru hotel room
content: In Mysuru, a jilted lover, Siddaraju, is in custody for the alleged murder of Darshitha in a Saligrama lodge. Police suspect an electrical object was used, causing severe wounds to her face and mouth. Darshitha, a mother from Hunsur, was found dead in a pool of blood.

title: Why humans can't digest grass: Understanding the biological limitations
content: Humans lack the digestive enzymes and specialized anatomy to break down cellulose, the main component of grass, unlike herbivores. Early human ancestors consumed plant material, but their digestive systems weren't adapted for large quantities of cellulose-rich grasses. Grass offers minimal nutritional value, making it an unsuitable food source for humans, who require a varied diet.

title: Why Musk called Trump's pick for US envoy to India a 'snake'
content: But by 2020, with Paul‚Äôs influence waning and Trump ascendant, Gor made the switch. He joined Trump‚Äôs re-election machine, helped manage fundraising, and became a close ally of Donald Trump Jr. Together they founded Winning Team Publishing, turning Trump‚Äôs doodles and grudges into glossy bestsellers. The ‚Äúsnake‚Äù was learning to coil tighter around power.

title: 'Work from jail?' BJP mocks oppn attack on 'criminal bill'; Kejriwal's 'personal' reply
content: Arvind Kejriwal has launched a sharp retort to Amit Shah's defense of the 130th constitutional amendment bill, which proposes disqualifying lawmakers jailed for over 30 days in serious cases. Kejriwal questioned the ethics of inducting criminals into parties and rewarding them with high office. Shah expressed confidence that the bill, aimed at upholding constitutional morality, would pass despite opposition.

title: Legend opens up! Did Arjun Tendulkar get engaged to Saaniya Chandhok?
content: Sachin Tendulkar has confirmed his son Arjun Tendulkar's engagement to Saaniya Chandhok. The announcement came during a Reddit AMA. Arjun and Saaniya exchanged rings on August 13 in a private ceremony. Saaniya is the granddaughter of Ravi Ghai, from the Graviss Group. The young cricketer represents Goa in domestic cricket. News of the engagement had sparked widespread attention online.

title: Aaron Rodgers already sidelined in Steelers‚Äô plans as Mike Tomlin backs another QB
content: Aaron Rodgers' arrival in Pittsburgh is big news. But the Steelers' success depends on the whole team. Veterans and young players are key. Skylar Thompson's preseason performance shows the team's depth. Coach Mike Tomlin trusts proven players. The Steelers' season depends on coaching, health, and the team. Their gritty, team-first style will decide their playoff chances.

title: Dowry death: Nikki's father says 'affair' led to murder; probe reveals pattern of violence
content: Nikki Bhati died after allegedly being set on fire by her husband and in-laws over dowry demands, prompting her father's desperate plea for justice. Following this, Nikki's husband, Vipin, was shot in the leg during an attempted escape while in police custody.

title: CBSE parenting workshops 2025 explained: Strategies, effective collaboration, and more
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has announced offline parenting workshops for September 2025, building on its Parenting Calendar 2025‚Äì26. Designed to equip parents with practical strategies, the workshops focus on holistic student growth, positive parenting, digital well-being, and resilience. Scheduled across multiple cities, they aim to strengthen collaboration between schools and families for student development.

title: What's behind India's China shift? Goyal explains; hints at 'tons' of reforms
content: Amidst potential US tariffs, India asserts its improved relations with China are separate from US trade talks. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expresses confidence in India's economic resilience and ongoing efforts to deepen the India-US relationship.

title: 'Flop scene': BJP mocks TMC MLA's 'clownish' escape bid; targets CM Mamata
content: BJP IT chief Amit Malviya criticized TMC MLA Jiban Krishna Saha's attempt to evade the ED as a staged act orchestrated by Mamata Banerjee, following Saha's arrest in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. Malviya alleged that such stunts are a TMC strategy to avoid accountability for looting Bengal, further claiming the party fears exposure as the 2026 elections approach.

title: 75+ Happy Hartalika Teej wishes, messages, greetings and quotes for 2025
content: Hartalika Teej, a festival celebrated with devotion in several Indian states, honors the divine union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Women observe a fast, offering prayers for their husbands' well-being and family prosperity. The occasion is marked by exchanging heartfelt wishes and messages, fostering positivity and celebrating the enduring bonds of love and faith.

title: PM Modi degree row: Delhi HC says DU not bound to share BA records
content: The Delhi High Court overturned a Central Information Commission (CIC) order on Monday, which had instructed the disclosure of information pertaining to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's bachelor's degree. Justice Sachin Datta delivered the verdict following a petition from Delhi University challenging the CIC's directive.

title: 'Aadhar bhi bheju kya?': Sachin Tendulkar silences fan with hilarious comment
content: Sachin Tendulkar's recent Reddit AMA session became a hit, filled with humor and insights. When a fan questioned his identity, Tendulkar playfully responded, ‚ÄúShould I also send my Aadhaar card?‚Äù He discussed his favorite innings, the 2008 knock against England, and revealed advising MS Dhoni's promotion in the 2011 World Cup final.

title: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô mom shines with sideline charm and game-day glam
content: As the Chiefs prepare for their 2025 season opener, Randi Mahomes shines as a sideline sensation alongside Brittany. They capture the family's game-day joy, blending style and team spirit. Randi's heartfelt interactions and Brittany's documentation of the kids' love for football showcase the family's unity and emotional depth, proving their spirit is as important as the game itself.

title: Infiltration bid foiled: Soldiers spot suspicious movement, open fire; search ops on
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Uri sector, Indian troops initiated search operations after spotting suspicious movement and opening fire along the Line of Control. Earlier, multiple drones from Pakistan were observed hovering over forward areas in the Poonch district, prompting security forces to launch a search operation.

title: 'Two reasons': Sachin Tendulkar breaks silence on promoting MS Dhoni over Yuvraj Singh
content: Sachin Tendulkar engaged with fans in a Reddit AMA, confirming his suggestion to promote MS Dhoni in the 2011 World Cup final, citing the left-right combination and Dhoni's familiarity with Muralitharan. He also highlighted his unbeaten 103 against England in Chennai in 2008 as his most meaningful innings, recalling India's successful chase of 387 and subsequent series victory.

title: 'Hallmark of cowardly govt': Rahul after protesters lathicharged; 'time to fight back'
content: Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, have strongly criticized the central government over the alleged lathi-charge on SSC aspirants protesting in Delhi, accusing the Modi government of ignoring the youth's concerns and manipulating elections. The leaders condemned the police action, while Delhi Police denied the lathi-charge, stating that some protestors were detained for refusing to leave after the permitted time.

title: Ilona Maher hints at WWE future after World Cup; says she‚Äôs single, staying focused
content: Rugby star Ilona Maher is garnering attention both on and off the field. WWE has expressed interest in her, but Maher emphasizes that no decisions will be made until after the Women‚Äôs Rugby World Cup 2025.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Old videos of Pranit More mocking Salman Khan resurface
content: Bigg Boss 19 premiered with comedian Pranit More as a contestant, sparking controversy as old videos resurfaced showing him roasting host Salman Khan. These clips feature jokes about Salman's bracelet, NGO ambassadorship, and career influence.

title: Z+ security for Delhi CM: 40 personnel to protect ; how two-layer protection will work
content: Following a recent attack, Delhi Police has significantly enhanced security for Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, upgrading her protection to Z+ cover. Over forty personnel will be permanently deployed, and stringent checks will be implemented at all her events, including 'Jan Sunwai' programs. The enhanced measures include a two-circle security system and thorough frisking of all visitors, ensuring the chief minister's safety.

title: Trump spotted with hand makeup, swollen ankles; concerns over venous condition rise
content: US President Donald Trump's recent public appearances have sparked health concerns due to visible makeup on his hands and previously reported swollen ankles. The White House confirmed Trump has chronic venous insufficiency (CVI), though officials claim he experiences no discomfort. Despite assertions of health transparency, public speculation persists, fueled by images and a recent poll indicating doubts about full disclosure.

title: 'They wanted Mercedes or Rs 60L': Kin of Noida dowry victim recall torture
content: Nikki, a 26-year-old woman, was allegedly murdered by her in-laws in Greater Noida for dowry, sparking outrage and demands for strict action. Her family recounts years of harassment, including physical assault and escalating demands for money and luxury items.

title: Rohit Sharma meets fan girl, signs her painting, gesture goes viral - See pics
content: Rohit Sharma, adored by fans, recently charmed a young admirer with a signed portrait. He transitioned from Test and T20I cricket, potentially returning for an ODI series against Australia.

title: OPT in crisis: Why Indian students in US could be hardest hit by F-1 visa shake-up
content: The OPT program, a crucial pathway for international students seeking U.S. work experience, faces potential elimination and new taxes, creating uncertainty. Indian students, the largest group of STEM graduates, could be significantly impacted, potentially leading to decreased enrollment and a shift of talent to countries with more stable post-study work options. Universities and employers also risk losing talent and revenue.

title: ITR filing: How to download Form 16? Step-by-step guide for taxpayers
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Salaried taxpayers preparing to file their Income Tax Return (ITR) for AY 2025-26, with a deadline of September 15, 2025, should have their Form 16 ready. This form, downloadable from the TRACES portal, details taxable salary income and taxes deducted.

title: Fantasy baseball news: Guerrero ready to return; Semien might be done for 2025
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . the schedule begins at 6:35 p.m. ET with the Baltimore Orioles hosting the Boston Red Sox .

title: 'His kids were getting messed with at school': How Ryan Day handles the pressures at Ohio State
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day leans back into the leather couch in his office days away from the showdown against top-ranked Texas . day took over for Urban Meyer in 2019 after just two seasons on his staff . only two other active college football head coaches have won national titles . "you'll never get the benefit of the doubt with elizabeth ii," says day .

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Orlando Pride are officially in a slump
content: alyssa Thompson scores for Angel City in the 86th minute to defeat Orlando 1-0 . the current continue to take care of business as far and away the league's hottest team . it's the 10th in a row without a loss for the league leaders .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material as you prepare to make the best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot at a championship.

title: The favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the US Open contenders
content: the new big two of men's tennis is overwhelmingly favored to make it three straight Slam finals against each other . Aryna Sabalenka is a brilliant 67-13 on the season but has fallen short late in all three Slams and must fend off a torrid Iga Swiatek .

title: Supreme Court forms SIT to examine complaints against Vantara
content: A Bench of Justices was hearing two petitions, one filed by advocate Jaya Sukin, alleging unlawful accusation of animals from India and abroad, mistreatment of the animals in captivity, financial irregularities, money laundering, etc

title: ‚ÄòA.P. government focused on welfare, development of handloom and handicrafts sector‚Äô
content: Welfare schemes include the NTR Pension Bharosa under which government provides financial aide of ‚Çπ445 crore annually and ‚Çπ4,000 monthly assistance to 92,724 weavers in the State, says Handlooms and Handcrafts Development Honorary Advisor Suchitra Ella

title: Scrapping cotton import duty will push farmers into distress: Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: ‚ÄúThis move comes at a particularly bad time as farmers prepare to harvest their crop,‚Äù say SKM leaders

title: Air-drop test success a big step in Gaganyaan mission: ISRO scientist
content: The ISRO will follow up IADT-01 with the second Test Vehicle Mission (TV-D2) and the un-crewed Gaganyaan-1 (G1) flight, said¬†Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre director Rajarajan

title: General Dwivedi holds defence talks with Algerian senior military leadership
content: General Dwivedi‚Äôs visit is expected to lay the groundwork for a long-term defence partnership, strengthening Army-to-Army cooperation and reinforcing shared principles of sovereignty, non-alignment, and South-South cooperation

title: Incarcerated MP Engineer Rashid‚Äôs supporters hold protest¬†in New Delhi for his release
content: Demanding that the Baramulla MP be released, his supporters say jailing him ‚Äòdespite overwhelming public support is unjust and travesty of justice‚Äô. Arrested on ‚Äòterror funding‚Äô charges, Mr. Rashid is incarcerated for six years now. His Awami Ittehad Party calls for the release of ‚Äòall innocents‚Äô

title: Expecting a timeline on J&K Statehood from SC, says CM Omar Abdullah
content: Abdullah‚Äôs statement came after the SC on Monday refused an urgent hearing on the J&K Statehood petition and instead listed the matter for October 10 this year

title: Kharge makes strong pitch to increase representation of women within Congress
content: The Congress chief urged party workers to take forward the campaign of ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô (vote theft) launched by Rahul Gandhi to the grassroots level across the country

title: CBI arrests four cyber frauds for duping foreign nationals
content: The agency arrested Arjun Prakash when he was about to board a flight to Kathmandu; three others were nabbed for running a call centre that hacked into bank accounts of the victims

title: Indian Navy to commission stealth frigates Udaygiri, Himgiri at Visakhapatnam
content: Both vessels are follow-on variants of the Shivalik-class frigates, featuring enhanced stealth capabilities, advanced weaponry, and modern sensor systems

title: Children are dying in clinics from starvation in Gaza: WFP‚Äôs Carl Skau
content: India is competent to address issue of hunger and nutritional insecurity, it is a food surplus country: WFP official

title: 130th Constitutional Amendment Bill to strengthen morality, good governance in politics: BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla says while the nation is welcoming the initiative, political parties such as the Congress and the Aam Aadmi Party are opposing it ‚Äúonly to protect corruption‚Äù

title: Stalin¬†deputes two Ministers to take part in Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: Minister for Hindu Religious & Charitable Endowments P.K. Sekarbabu and Minister for Information Technology and Digital Services Palanivel Thiaga Rajan would take part in the event

title: Bihar voters challenging deletions will mandatory hearing, says Election Commission of India
content: A senior official says that the Electoral Registration Officer will take a call on their inclusion in the final list; to those excluded, the officer will issue a ‚Äòspeaking order‚Äô, stating the reasons for the decision

title: College teachers raise concern over declining enrolment in Science courses
content: The workshop, held to receive feedback for developing parameters for a proposed State Institutional Ranking Framework (SIRF), drew a flurry of comments from the participating faculty

title: Madras¬†High Court appoints Special Investigation Team to probe kidney sale racket
content: The team will be headed by Inspector-General of Police (South Zone) Prem Anand¬†Sinha. The court will monitor the probe. The team has been asked to submit a report on the progress of the probe

title: Watch: Cheteshwar Pujara, India‚Äôs iconic Test batter, retires with 7195 runs, 19 centuries
content: From his debut in 2010 to his heroic performances in Australia, Pujara leaves behind a legacy of courage, triple-centuries in first-class cricket, and an unmatched role in India‚Äôs Test victories.

title: Nadendla launches Smart Rice Card distribution in Vijayawada
content: 4.42 crore cards, which ensure transparency in supply of ration through Fair Price Shops, will be distributed in nine districts initially, he says

title: RSS labour wing demands immediate implementation of wage and social security codes
content: The Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh also demanded the withdrawal of the facial recognition system introduced by the Women and Child Welfare Ministry under its ICDS scheme

title: Security guard falls onto metro track at Ragigudda station, rescued safely
content: A BMRCL source told The Hindu that the guard had been on duty for nearly 16 hours with only a short rest before reporting back to work

title: No objection to Banu Mushtaq inaugurating Dasara festival if she respects deity, says Yaduveer
content: Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar, Mysuru MP, has said he has no objection to Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq inaugurating the Dasara festival if she respects the deity of Chamundeshwari

title: Kerala moves to revive Sabari Rail with push for land acquisition
content: State directs District Collectors of Kottayam, Idukki, and Ernakulam to begin acquiring the remaining land for the project.

title: Kerala makes blind spot mirrors mandatory on heavy vehicles
content: The move is aimed¬†at enhancing overall road safety and reduce fatal accidents involving pedestrians, motorcyclists and pillion riders, who constitute a majority of all road accidents.

title: Woman found dead with mouth blown up in a lodge in Mysuru district
content: Police arrest woman‚Äôs boyfriend after mysterious death in Mysuru lodge, investigating possible explosive involvement in the incident

title: India alerts Pakistan about potential flood
content: Though Pakistan was informed, the Pakistan Foreign Office pointed out that the warning was communicated through diplomatic channels rather than the Indus Waters Commission

title: Delhi High Court directive to quash order on disclosing PM‚Äôs degree is ‚Äòincomprehensible‚Äô, says Congress
content: The party‚Äôs response came after the Delhi High Court quashed a Central Information Commission (CIC) order directing disclosure of details related to Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs bachelor‚Äôs degree while holding it to be ‚Äòpersonal information‚Äô and ruling out any ‚Äòimplicit public interest‚Äô in it

title: SIT continues questioning complainant in Dharmasthala case
content: The Belthangady police too continued questioning YouTuber Sameer in connection with three cases registered against him

title: Two industrial parks to generate 8,000 jobs in Kuppam soon, says official
content: ‚ÄòState government plans aim to boost rural economy and support livelihoods in Kuppam through new industrial initiatives‚Äô

title: Tribal Ministry urges separate Census enumeration for particularly vulnerable tribal groups
content: The Ministry said that while data on Scheduled Tribes was collected during the 2011 Census, ‚Äúdata separately for PVTGs was not collected‚Äù

title: Held nearly 5,000 structured meetings with political parties: Election Commission¬†of India
content: These meetings provide a platform for the parties to share their suggestions and concerns directly with the commission

title: Backwater landscape of Kottayam to come alive with rhythms of rural life this Onam season
content: Responsible Tourism Mission Kerala has launched a set of ‚Äòvillage life experience‚Äô packages. Experiences on offer include coir making, coconut climbing, leaf craft, Thiruvathirakali, fishing, shikara boat rides, and kayaking

title: Andhra Pradesh optimises water, ensures supply to parched Rayalaseema
content: Krishna and Godavari waters managed efficiently with calibrated releases to deltas and Rayalaseema, say officials

title: Probe sought into suspected unnatural deaths of people who quit Nakshbandi Thareeqath
content: Kerala State Human Rights Commission has already registered a case and sought a report from the police about the suspected human rights violations in the name of safeguarding the Thareeqath rules by the Sufi order based in Kozhikode district‚Äôs Koduvally

title: Kerala to launch mass campaign on preventive measures against amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: All wells and water storage tanks in houses and institutions across the State should be cleaned and chlorinated on August 30 and 31, says Health Minister Veena George. All districts have been asked to stock adequate drugs for treating the infection

title: Wagamon emerges as most favourite tourist destination in Idukki
content: During the January-July period in 2025, a total of 5,43,979 tourists visited Wagamon Meadows and 4,10,805 visited Wagamon Adventure Park

title: Elaborate security arrangements ahead of Ganesh festival, Id Milad in twin cities
content: Meetings with various religious heads and elders have been conducted, routes fixed for processions and safety guidelines issued

title: Free power for Ganesh pandals across Andhra Pradesh
content: Government to bear ‚Çπ25 crore expenditure to provide free electricity to around 15,000 Ganesh pandals; Durga Puja pandals to get similar benefit during Vijayadasami

title: NAREDCO 11th Amaravati Property Festival in Vijayawada from September 19
content: Three-day mega expo will serve as a one-stop platform for homebuyers to explore approved projects, interact with banks for guidance, and discover interior and home improvement solutions

title: Mysuru City Corporation hosts workshop on making eco-friendly Ganesha idols
content: Artists from Chamarajendra Academy of Visual Arts guided the participants in crafting eco-friendly idols using natural clay

title: Healthcare initiative Bharat BRAIN to be launched at Amaravati soon

title: New task force to target drug trafficking in Gujarat
content: The unit is a separate entity from the existing 34-member Narcotics Cell and will report to the State CID

title: IIA and French team develop new method to compute more realistic properties of stellar atmospheres
content: A researcher from the Indian Institute of Astrophysics, working with collaborators from Institut de Recherche en Astrophysique et Plan√©tologie, France, have developed a method to compute more realistic properties of stellar atmospheres

title: YSRCP leader asks government to respond soon to shortage of fertilizers in A.P.
